intro: Lepturus, commonly known as the common mallow, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is found in various regions across Europe and Asia. Lepturus has a hairy stem and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
